name: Carnoustie Golf Course Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recommend to stay here by our travel agent Thorne Travel and they were soo right. The staff were fab and the view from the balconey was amazing. We were caught out by the snow and as the weather worsen we had to leave a day earler to get home. We will be back again to have the most relaxing and pampered time.
reviews.title: fantastic place and service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night based on B&B and enjoyed it. Only complaint was the room was not very warm as the radiator was not functioning correctly but overall we had a nice big room and breakfast was freshly cooked for and we would return.
reviews.title: Good price to pay for B&B

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thje swimming pool and steam were not very warm at all but the hot tub was great.
reviews.title: Location, comfort and excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Freindly staff, good choice for breakfast, cooked breakfast cooked to order, rooms clean and comfortable, would definately stay again and recomend to friends and family
reviews.title: Grab a deal and go there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from Carnoustie and cannot praise this hotel high enough! From the moment we arrived at reception until the moment we left we were given excellent service. Our room, although were did not ask for a "room with a view" was great as we overlooked the 1st and 18th and as we are golfers we were delighted. As the weather was not too great on our first day we were able to fill our day with walks and used the leisure facilities. A great way to relax and look out at the cold windy weather which you would expect in November. Food in the restaurant was good but if we are totally honest we would have preferred a wee bit more on our plate...but what we had was very tasty! Outwith the high season there are lots of deals out there and we would advise you to snap them up as we experienced a wee bit luxury at a great price!
reviews.title: Carnoustie Links Hotel without playing golf is First class

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here for 4 nights and enjoyed our stay in this hotel - and got a very good deal!. We had a room overlooking the 18 green and 1st tee, which was great in the evenings as we could watch the last few groups come in. The room was in good condition, clean and well equipped (most of the things you would expect in a 4 star hotel). The internet cost though - and as usual the charges are steep!
reviews.title: A room with a view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The leisure facilities were also v good - a small but well equipped gym and a pool etc. The breakfast was good - quality and quantity (except for the croissants which soon disappeared), but the service in the dining room could be a bit haphazard - as if no one was really in charge.
reviews.title: Weekend stay in Carnoustie

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: There is a good kids play area very close and the beach is a 1 minute walk - but there is not much other than golf in Carnoustie.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010
reviews.text: Worst hotel I've stayed in this year. My wife was treated really badly in the Spa, very unprofessional with inconsiderate staff. Complained but asst Gen. Mgr disinterested. TV not tuned correctly, 30mins wait for a cold sandwich in bar at a quiet lunch-time. £4/hr for wifi. The list could go on. If you are not a golfer then forget it. Nothing to do in Carnoustie.
reviews.title: A good quality hotel, great location and fantastic value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unfortunately cant find anything good to say.
reviews.title: Fantastic view of golf course

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the hotel during early February. The break was a Christmas gift chosen for us by one of our sons, so we did not actually choose the hotel ourselves.
reviews.title: The Very Good, The Good and the Really Not So Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly, the very good. The hotel is lovely, large open reception area where we were greeted very pleasantly and checked in quickly and efficiently.
reviews.title: AMAZINGGGGGG!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011
reviews.text: Had dinner in the hotel on the first evening - the dining room staff were excellent - very pleasant and helpful - a credit to the hotel. Food beautifully presented and delicious. Breakfasts on both days also very good and again staff fantastic.
reviews.title: Well Worth the Long Drive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The swimming pool was very nice, with jacuzzi, steam room and sauna - very clean.
reviews.title: Brilliant break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Now the really not so good. Our room on the second floor was very nicely furnished but, the voile curtain had been removed from the window (which overlooked the entrance to the hotel) and the window ledge was absolutely disgustingly dirty. The rest of the room seemed very clean so this is one for the Housekeeper to check up on. (I did clean one half of the window ledge)
reviews.title: New Year Celebrations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had been reading reviews and was in some doubt about staying here... and was pleasantly surprised.
reviews.title: Convenient, friendly good hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff were friendly and very helpful, remembering my likes/dislikes with food too.
reviews.title: Overpriced dirty rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel in general, bedroom & bathroom were all cleaned to a high standard on arrival and each day. The bedroom overlooked the golf course and was remarkably quiet.
reviews.title: 3rd time unlucky in this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food was good and allowed for our special requests (salad instead of potatoes etc.)
reviews.title: Pity about the bathroom floor

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The situation is good, plenty parking and also near to the mainline railway.
reviews.title: Overall a nice stay

description: One of Scotland's premium destinations for guests seeking luxury golfing and leisure facilities, the Carnoustie Hotel has 85 en suite bedrooms providing enviable views over the infamous Championship Golf Course or the sea. Overlooking the 1st and 18th tee, guests can enjoy a wide selection of finely prepared Scottish cuisine to excite their taste buds in either the Dalhousie Restaurant, Calders Bar or on The Terrace, whilst enjoying the spectacular views. With guaranteed daily tee times on the Buddon, Burnside and Championship links, Carnoustie Golf Hotel is a unique golfing haven, offering some of the most stimulating golf in the world.
